title: Dennis Rodman is charged with slapping an acquaintance inside a Florida bar
text:
Dennis Rodman has been charged with a single misdemeanor count of battery after he allegedly slapped an acquaintance at his 58th birthday party in Florida.

Rodman's attorney, Lorne Berkeley, entered a not guilty plea in court on the athlete's behalf on Thursday - five months after the alleged incident took place at the Buddha Sky Bar in Delray Beach.

Police say Rodman was celebrating his birthday at the bar on May 17, when he slapped an associate by the name of Jeff Soulouque.

An affidavit says Soulouque was standing behind the star who suddenly turned around and smacked him on the face without being provoked.

Dennis Rodman has been charged with a single misdemeanor count of battery pertaining to an incident that allegedly occurred back in May

Rodman is said to have immediately apologized and invited Solouque for dinner the next day.

Miami-based Solouque is a business developer who is friends with one of Rodman's managers. The pair had reportedly met several times prior to the incident.

'It was out of nowhere. He just hit me and I was blindsided and he started charging me,' Solouque told The Sun Sentinel several days after the purported attack.

'I was like, "What is your problem?"

Soulouque claimed he was left with swelling and a corneal abrasion that left him unable to concentrate on work.

However, Rodman's attorney has fiercely denied the attack took place, and the general manager of the Sky Bar also expressed surprise over the alleged incident.

'No employees or management witnessed it. Nobody had any inkling. It’s the most bizarre situation we’ve ever seen,' they told the Sun Sentinel.

The alleged incident took place at the Buddha Sky Bar in Delray Beach

The attack allegedly took place outside the view of surveillance cameras.

It's unclear why it has taken so long for police to charge Rodman.

If found guilty, he could face up to a 12 months in county jail, as well as a year's probation and a $1000 fine.

It's not the first time Rodman has had a run-in with the law.

He was arrested for a DUI in 2008.

In 2016, the star was was charged with causing a hit-and-run accident, lying to police, and driving without a license.

Meanwhile, Rodman avoided charges after he was accused of stealing products from a California yoga store just days before his 58th birthday party.

The owner of VIBES Hot Yoga studio in Newport Beach claimed the basketballer took $300 in merchandise from the store.

However, Rodman later told TMZ that it was a misunderstanding, and staffers told him he was able to take a few products as gifts.
description: Rodman's attorney, Lorne Berkeley, entered a not guilty plea in a Florida court on Thursday on behalf of the athlete.
